alert.note: Alert for Canadian; Cleveland; Kingfisher; Lincoln; Logan; McClain; Noble; Oklahoma; Payne; Pottawatomie (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 10 at 3:42AM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Kingfisher, Oklahoma, Lincoln, southeastern Noble, Cleveland, Logan, Payne, eastern Canadian, northwestern Pottawatomie and western McClain Counties through 415 AM CDT... At 341 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking the leading edge of winds from strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Pawnee to 3 miles north of Wellston to near Newcastle. Movement was southeast at 50 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Oklahoma City, Norman, Edmond, Moore, Midwest City, Stillwater, Shawnee, Del City, El Reno, Guthrie, Cushing, Newcastle, Tecumseh, Purcell, Chandler, Yukon, Bethany, Mustang, Choctaw, and Warr Acres. This includes the following highways... Interstate 35 between mile markers 92 and 175. Interstate 40 between mile markers 130 and 194. Interstate 44 between mile markers 105 and 182. Interstate 240 between mile markers 1 and 16. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
